revision.comment: Undid revision 701801729 by [[Special:Contributions/2601:403:4000:6DE1:BC40:3EEF:91C4:A522|2601:403:4000:6DE1:BC40:3EEF:91C4:A522]] ([[User talk:2601:403:4000:6DE1:BC40:3EEF:91C4:A522|talk]])"Decisive" would have to be sourced
revision.text:
{{Infobox military conflict |conflict= Battle of Knjaževac |image= |caption= |partof=the [[Second Balkan War]] |date= 4–7 July 1913 |result= Bulgarian victory |place=[[Knjaževac]], [[Kingdom of Serbia]] |combatant1={{flag|Kingdom of Bulgaria}} |combatant2={{flag|Kingdom of Serbia}} |commander1={{flagicon|Bulgaria}} [[Vasil Kutinchev]] |commander2={{flagicon|Serbia}} [[Vukoman Aračić]] |strength1= 56,689 men, 108 guns''Кратък обзор на бойния състав, организацията, попълването и мобилизацията на българската армия '', pag. 92-93;Държавно военно издателство,София 1961 |strength2= 40,000 men, 68 guns[http://www.bulgarianartillery.it/Bulgarian%20Artillery%201/T_OOB/Interallied%20War_Serbia.htm The Serbian and Greek Armies at the beginning of the Interallied War] |casualties1=280 dead
820 wounded |casualties2=unknown }} {{Campaignbox Second Balkan War}} The '''Battle of Knjaževac''' was a battle of the [[Second Balkan War]], fought between the [[Bulgaria]]n and the [[Kingdom of Serbia|Serbian]] army. The battle took in July 1913 and ended with the capture of the Serbian city by the [[Bulgaria]]n [[First Army (Bulgaria)|1st Army]].{{cite book| last =Hall | first =Richard | title =The Balkan Wars, 1912-1913: Prelude to the First World War| publisher =Routledge| year =2000 | isbn =0-415-22946-4 | page =116}} ==References== {{Reflist|1}} ==Sources== * {{cite book |title=The Balkan Wars, 1912–1913: Prelude to the First World War |last=Hall |first=Richard C. |year=2000 |publisher=Routledge |isbn=0-415-22946-4 }} {{coord missing}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Knjazevac}} [[Category:Battles of the Second Balkan War]] [[Category:Battles involving Bulgaria]] [[Category:Battles involving Serbia]] [[Category:Conflicts in 1913]] [[Category:1913 in Bulgaria]] [[Category:1913 in Serbia]]
